member.name: T:NetSpell.SpellChecker.Dictionary
member.summary: The Dictionary class encapsulates all functions associated with the word dictionary.
member.remarks: When adding or removing words, you must call save before using the dictionary because the word list must be sorted.

member.name: M:NetSpell.SpellChecker.Dictionary.#ctor
member.summary: Dictionary default constructor

member.name: M:NetSpell.SpellChecker.Dictionary.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Dictionary constructor that takes in a file name to automatically load the dictionary from

param.name: fileName
param.para: The name of the dictionary file to load

member.name: M:NetSpell.SpellChecker.Dictionary.AddWord(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a word to the dictionary
member.remarks: You must call save before using the dictionary because the word list must be sorted.

param.name: word
param.para: The word to add to the dictionary

member.name: M:NetSpell.SpellChecker.Dictionary.Load
member.summary: Loads the Dictionary Word List from the FileName

member.summary: Loads the Dictionary Word List from the FileName

member.name: T:NetSpell.SpellChecker.DoubleMetaphone
member.summary: The double metaphone class is used to generate a code for what the word sounds like
member.remarks:
Double Metaphone (c) 1998, 1999 by Lawrence Philips
Slightly modified by Kevin Atkinson to fix several bugs and to allow it to give back more than 4 characters.
Converted to C# by Paul Welter

member.name: M:NetSpell.SpellChecker.Spelling.Soundex(System.String)
member.summary: A code that represents how the word sounds phonetically based on the way that it's spelled

param.name: word
param.para: The word to generate soundex code on

member.remarks:
* Made obsolete by DoubleMetaphone class. This method is no longer used.
This function is based off the Poor Man's Spell Checker by Sam Kirchmeier.
http://www.kirchmeier.org/code/pmsc/
member.returns: The soundex code for the word

member.name: M:NetSpell.SpellChecker.Spelling.SpellCheck
member.summary: Spell checks the words in the property starting at the position
member.returns: Returns true if there is a word found in the text that is not in the dictionaries

member.name: M:NetSpell.SpellChecker.Spelling.SpellCheck(System.Int32)
member.summary: Spell checks the words in the property starting at the position. This overload takes in the WordIndex to start checking from.

param.name: startWordIndex
param.para: The index of the word to start checking from.

member.returns: Returns true if there is a word found in the text that is not in the dictionaries

member.name: M:NetSpell.SpellChecker.Spelling.SpellCheck(System.String)
member.summary: Spell checks the words in the property starting at the position. This overload takes in the text to spell check

param.name: text
param.para: The text to spell check

member.returns: Returns true if there is a word found in the text that is not in the dictionaries

member.name: M:NetSpell.SpellChecker.Spelling.SpellCheck(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Spell checks the words in the property starting at the position. This overload takes in the text to check and the WordIndex to start checking from.

param.name: text
param.para: The text to spell check

param.name: startWordIndex
param.para: The index of the word to start checking from

member.returns: Returns true if there is a word found in the text that is not in the dictionaries

member.name: M:NetSpell.SpellChecker.Spelling.Suggest
member.summary: Populates the property with word suggestions for the

member.name: M:NetSpell.SpellChecker.Spelling.TestWord(System.String)
member.summary: Checks to see if the word is in the dictionary

param.name: word
param.para: The word to check

member.returns: Returns true if word is found in dictionary

member.name: M:NetSpell.SpellChecker.Spelling.WordSimilarity(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Rates the words similarity based on two criteria: length, and letter content. SimilarWord is awarded some points if it is about the same length as the word. It is also awarded one point for each letter that they share.

param.name: word
param.para: The base word to compare SimilarWord to

param.name: similarWord
param.para: The word to rate similarity with

member.remarks:
This function is based off the Poor Man's Spell Checker by Sam Kirchmeier.
http://www.kirchmeier.org/code/pmsc/
member.returns: The score of how similar the words are

member.name: M:NetSpell.SpellChecker.Spelling.OnDoubledWord(NetSpell.SpellChecker.WordEventArgs)
member.summary: This is the method that is responsible for notifying receivers that the event occurred

member.name: M:NetSpell.SpellChecker.Spelling.OnEndOfText(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This is the method that is responsible for notifying receivers that the event occurred

member.name: M:NetSpell.SpellChecker.Spelling.OnMisspelledWord(NetSpell.SpellChecker.WordEventArgs)
member.summary: This is the method that is responsible for notifying receivers that the event occurred

member.name: M:NetSpell.SpellChecker.Spelling.ExtraChar(System.Collections.ArrayList@)
member.summary: try omitting one char of word at a time

member.name: M:NetSpell.SpellChecker.Spelling.ForgotChar(System.Collections.ArrayList@)
member.summary: try inserting a tryme character before every letter

member.name: M:NetSpell.SpellChecker.Spelling.ReplaceChars(System.Collections.ArrayList@)
member.summary: suggestions for a typical fault of spelling, that differs with more, than 1 letter from the right form.

member.name: M:NetSpell.SpellChecker.Spelling.SwapChar(System.Collections.ArrayList@)
member.summary: try swapping adjacent chars one by one

member.name: M:NetSpell.SpellChecker.Spelling.TwoWords(System.Collections.ArrayList@)
member.summary: split the string into two pieces after every char if both pieces are good words make them a suggestion

member.name: M:NetSpell.SpellChecker.Spelling.BadChar(System.Collections.ArrayList@)
member.summary: swap out each char one by one and try all the tryme chars in its place to see if that makes a good word
